intro: Gymnanthemum senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese gymnanthemum, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
